item.title: Paper Reading 3 pass
item.description:
Reference: https://codearsonist.com/reading-for-programmers

3 pass Overview:

  1. Verify
    1. Value
    2. Background
  2. Grasp
    1. Thought Process
    2. Highlights
    3. Diagram
    4. Unknowns
    5. References
  3. Understand
    1. Holes
    2. Implementations
    3. Notes

Process

Verify

  • This provides High level view of the contents.
  • Start with references usually.
  • Mark the cited papers I’ve read as to get previous notes I have made and
  • verify the background.
  • Title, Abstract, Introduction–> Read very carefully
  • Scan through to find diagrams, equations.

  • Questions to ask during first pass

    • What type of paper is this?
    • Context: How is it related to and which other papers?
    • Correctness: Do assumptions appear to be valid?
    • Contributions of the paper
    • Clarity: well written?

  • Now you ask yourself?

item.title: Bibliography Management
item.description:
What do the files mean?

Here, I store all bibliography entries in article.bib , pdfs to pdfs folder, notes in articles.org file. That’s all there is to understand.

  (setq bibtex-completion-library-path "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/pdfs/"
      bibtex-completion-bibliography "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/org/references/articles.bib"
      bibtex-completion-notes-path "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/org/references/articles.org"
      bibtex-completion-notes-path "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/org/references/articles.org")

  (setq org-ref-notes-directory "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/org/notes/"
      org-ref-bibliography-notes "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/org/references/articles.org"
      org-ref-default-bibliography '("c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/org/references/articles.bib")
      org-ref-pdf-directory "c:/Users/sagar/Dropbox/pdfs")

Using these files

  1. Adding entries:
    • Find a paper, add it to aricles.bib. Either DOI or paper link.
    • If pdf found by org-ref, okay.
    • Else doi-utils-get-bibtex-entry-pdf run it.
    • Now, on reading make an entry to articles.org file.
      • Either using org-ref-open-bibtex-notes
      • If article.bib not open, then use helm-bibtex.
  2. Taking notes:
    • org-noter for this
    • Searching: helm-bibtex.

item.title: Para
item.description:
Projects Areas Resources Archives

Projects

  • Group of related task
  • Specific outcomes
  • Specific deadlines

Areas

  • No deadline
  • Standards to be met
  • e.g. House, Work etc.

Resources

  • Not tied to specific project but of interest to you
  • e.g. Emacs, Productivity etc.

Archives

  • Inactive Projects, Areas or Resources.
  • Archived
